title: Urgent help required | Microsoft L61 vs Google L3
content:
I have joining at Google this week. Compensation : https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/5927833/google-india-swe-l3-bangalore/2688113

Education: 2020 grad
Years of Experience: ~4 YOE 
Prior Experience: US megacap company
Current Compensation: 18 LPA + 40K USD unvested RSUs (38%, 38%, 16%, 8%)

Date of the Offer: Recruiter submitted offer, yet to get approval. Requested recruiter to speed up the process. She said I'd receive offer by mid of next week earliest and shared the below estimates.

Company: Microsoft, D365 team.
Title/Level: L61
Location: Hyderabad
Salary: 25L to 30L 
Relocation Bonus: N/A
Signing Bonus: Upto 5L over 2 years.
Stock bonus: 45K USD to 55K USD (25% each year)
Bonus: upto 20% 

I see that L61 offers go till 75-80K RSU, but she didn't gave room for negotitation. Told me to only expect some surplus over the Google offer.

Liked Google team's tech stack (ML, TPU based). Other factors like location, level, Comp. seems better at MSFT. Help me select a better career path.

title: Amazon | System Development Engineer 1 | L4 | Sept 2024 | Chennai
content:
Education: B.Tech in Computer Science, Tier 2/3 College
Years of Experience: 1 Year 3 Months
Prior Experience: Investment Bank
Date of the Offer: Sept 2024
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: System Development Engineer 1
Location: Chennai, India
Salary: Rs ~20L
Relocation: Rs 1.5L
Signing Bonus: Rs 5L for the first year, Rs 4L for the second year
Stock bonus: 70 units stock grant vested over 4 years (5% for first year, 15% for second year, 20% every 6 months after that)
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): Rs 26.5L for the first year
Benefits: Standard Amazon benefits
Other details: Tried to negotiated once, the recruiter wasn't interested in doing so.

Probably not joining, as I feel low-balled in terms of stocks, have another competing offer.

[Interview Experience](https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6043543/Amazon-or-System-Development-Engineer-1-or-L4-or-Sept-2024-or-Chennai-Offer-Recieved)
